steps.name: Application Submission
steps.description: Submit application documents to HTW Dresden
steps.deadline: 15 June for winter semester and 15 November for summer semester

steps.name: Application Review
steps.description: Review of application documents by HTW Dresden

steps.name: Letter of Admission
steps.description: Issue of letter of admission by HTW Dresden

required_documents.name: Application for Admission
required_documents.description: Signed by you and your home university coordinator

steps.name: Course Selection Phase
steps.description: Select courses from the provided list
steps.deadline: Before the start of the semester

phases.name: Academic Coordinator / Learning Agreement / study schedule

steps.name: Receive Academic Coordinator
steps.description: Meet your supervising professor during the Welcome Week

steps.name: Create Learning Agreement
steps.description: List courses you'd like to attend via Online Learning Agreement (OLA)
steps.deadline: Before the start of the academic year

steps.name: Submit Learning Agreement
steps.description: Sign the Learning Agreement with your home university and HTWD
steps.deadline: Before the start of the academic year

steps.name: Create Study Schedule
steps.description: Plan your courses and timetable with your Academic Coordinator
steps.deadline: First weeks of your study visit

required_documents.name: Learning Agreement
required_documents.description: Signed agreement between you, your home university, and HTWD
required_documents.deadline: Before the start of the academic year

steps.name: Welcome Week
steps.description: Welcome activities for new students

steps.name: Lecture period
steps.description: Regular lectures for all courses

steps.name: Examination period
steps.description: Final exams for all courses

steps.name: Attend Information Sessions
steps.description: Attend the information sessions during the Welcome Week.

steps.name: Enroll in Language Courses
steps.description: Enroll in the language courses offered by the Language Center or TUDIAS.

steps.name: Start Language Course
steps.description: Begin the language course.

steps.name: Obtain Health Insurance
steps.description: Students from outside EU or EEA countries must take out a German health insurance.

steps.name: Prove Statutory Health Insurance
steps.description: Students from EU or EEA countries, Switzerland, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Serbia, Turkey, Tunisia, or the United Kingdom must show their European Health Insurance Card (EHIC), Global Health Insurance Card (from the UK) or Eligibility (from a treaty country).

dependencies.description: Letter of Admission from HTW Dresden is required for registration with a statutory health insurance.

required_documents.name: Letter of Admission
required_documents.description: Required for registration with a statutory health insurance.

steps.name: Check immigration formalities
steps.description: Check the immigration formalities available from the Federal Foreign Office and the German missions in your home country.

steps.name: Obtain a passport
steps.description: Obtain a passport if you don't have one.

steps.name: Arrange insurance and permits
steps.description: Arrange insurance and the necessary permits before leaving your home country.

steps.name: Apply for a student visa
steps.description: Apply for a student visa at the German embassy in your home country if you are not an EU citizen and plan to stay in Germany for more than three months.
steps.deadline: Several weeks/month before your planned entry to Germany

steps.name: Apply for residence permit
steps.description: Apply for a residence permit at the Dresden Immigration Office if you are an EU citizen or if you are a non-EU citizen who plans to stay in Germany for less than 360 days.
steps.deadline: Within three months after entry in Germany

required_documents.name: Residence permit for study purposes from the first EU Member State
required_documents.description: Valid passport, Declaration on securing livelihood, Declaration of sufficient health insurance cover
required_documents.deadline: Before applying for a student visa

steps.name: Apply for student residence
steps.description: Register directly at the Studentenwerk Dresden using the online application procedure.

steps.name: Get admission letter
steps.description: Obtain a copy of the admission letter from HTW Dresden.

steps.name: Pay semester contribution
steps.description: Exchange students need to pay the semester contribution by bank transfer from their home country before entering the country.

steps.name: Activate German semester ticket
steps.description: After paying the semester contribution, students can activate their German semester ticket via a cell phone app.

steps.name: Start living in Dresden
steps.description: Students can start living in Dresden after activating their German semester ticket.
steps.deadline: At the start of the semester

required_documents.name: Bank transfer confirmation
required_documents.description: Confirmation of the bank transfer showing the amount and date of transfer.

steps.name: Welcome Week Preparation
steps.description: Organize the Welcome Week in cooperation with faranto e.V.

steps.name: Welcome Week
steps.description: Include activities such as campus tour, registration at the International Office, and information sessions.

steps.name: Buddy Programme
steps.description: Organize the buddy programme through faranto e.V.

steps.name: Enrolment Phase
steps.description: Enrolment process for exchange students

required_documents.name: Proof of Health Insurance Recognized in Germany

steps.name: Receive Student Card
steps.description: Get the student card at the beginning of studies

steps.name: Apply for Semester Ticket
steps.description: Apply for the semester ticket through the university login platform
steps.deadline: 01.09. for winter semester and 01.03. for summer semester

steps.name: Access Digital Ticket
steps.description: Log in to the platform to access the digital ticket

dependencies.description: University login required for digital ticket access

required_documents.name: University Login
required_documents.description: Required for accessing the digital ticket platform

phases.name: Registration at the Citizens’ Office Dresden

steps.name: Make an appointment
steps.description: Schedule an appointment at the Citizens' Office Dresden

steps.name: Visit the Citizens' Office
steps.description: Register at the local Citizens' Office Dresden

steps.name: Make an appointment
steps.description: Send required information to the Immigration Office Dresden for an appointment.

steps.name: Submit application and documents
steps.description: Hand in the residence permit application and required documents at the Immigration Authority.
steps.deadline: Within the first three months after entering Germany

steps.name: Wait for processing
steps.description: Wait for the Immigration Office Dresden to process your application and documents.

steps.name: Receive decision
steps.description: Get the decision on your residence permit application from the Immigration Office Dresden.

required_documents.name: Fully completed application form
required_documents.description: Must be submitted with the application.
required_documents.deadline: Within the first three months after entering Germany

steps.name: Obtain MensaCard Emeal
steps.description: Get the MensaCard Emeal by depositing 5 EUR and presenting your HTW student ID and ID card/passport at the cash desks.

steps.name: Check website for locations and menus
steps.description: Find information about locations of canteens, cafeterias, and menus on the website of the Studentenwerk Dresden.

steps.name: Open a German bank account
steps.description: To open an account at a bank, you will need passport or national ID card for identification, confirmation of registration from the Resident Registration Office in Dresden, German tax identification number, and enrolment certificate from HTW Dresden.

steps.name: Receive a debit card
steps.description: Once you have opened a bank account you will receive a debit card, or cash card (EC-Karte).
enables: Use the debit card for transactions

required_documents.name: Confirmation of registration from the Resident Registration Office in Dresden

phases.name: Timetable / start of the lecture period

steps.name: Publish Timetable
steps.description: Publish the timetable for the upcoming semester
steps.deadline: mid September for winter semester, beginning of March for summer semester

steps.name: Check Timetable
steps.description: Students check the published timetable for their courses
steps.deadline: first few weeks of the semester

steps.name: Plan Individual Timetable
steps.description: Students plan their individual timetable for the semester
steps.deadline: first few weeks of the semester

phases.name: HTWD student Login and digital tools (eduroam, OPAL, HTW email...)

steps.name: Enroll at the International Office
steps.description: Receive your personal HTWD Login

steps.name: Access student account
steps.description: Log in to student computers, student web, library's resources, and HTWD email account

steps.name: Access digital tools
steps.description: Use digital tools, systems, and programs for studies

phases.name: Timetable (start / end of the course / break times)

steps.name: Determine time options for 3rd double period
steps.description: Choose between two time options for the 3rd double period
steps.deadline: Before the start of the course

phases.name: Room names and locations on the HTWD campus

steps.name: Determine Room Name
steps.description: Extract the letter indicating the location and the three digits indicating the floor and room number from the room name.

steps.name: Find Location and Floor
steps.description: Use the letter and digits to determine the location and floor of the room.

steps.name: Examination Registration
steps.description: Register for exams by sending the current learning agreement to the International Office.

steps.name: Exam Registration Confirmation
steps.description: Receive confirmation of exam registration from the International Office.

steps.name: Exam Deregistration
steps.description: Deregister from the examination up to one week before the examination date.

steps.name: Medical Certificate Submission
steps.description: Submit a medical certificate for withdrawal from an examination after the deregistration period.

steps.name: Retake Examination Arrangement
steps.description: Make arrangements for a retake examination date with the examiner.

dependencies.description: Submit the current version of the learning agreement to register for exams.

required_documents.name: Learning Agreement
required_documents.description: Current version of the learning agreement

steps.name: Wait for grades to be reported
steps.description: Wait for all grades to be reported by professors/lecturers
steps.deadline: 4 weeks after the official end of the examination period

steps.name: Confer with home university and Academic Coordinator
steps.description: Discuss prolongation of matriculation

steps.name: Submit prolongation of matriculation form
steps.description: Hand in signed form at the International Office
requires: Confer with home university and Academic Coordinator

steps.name: Pay semester contribution for re-registration
steps.description: Pay within the re-registration period

steps.name: Re-register for the next semester
steps.description: Pay the semester contribution and update the student ID card

dependencies.description: Payment confirmation and student ID update

required_documents.name: Payment confirmation
required_documents.description: Confirmation of payment received by HTWD

phases.name: Career Service at HTWD - Scouting SN

steps.name: Scouting SN Phase
steps.description: Supports international students in application procedures, job search, and internship search.

steps.name: Determine country of origin
steps.description: Check if you are from the EU, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, or Switzerland

steps.name: Check working hours
steps.description: Determine if you can work more than 20 hours a week or need special permission

steps.name: Find a doctor
steps.description: Search for a doctor who speaks your language in Dresden.

steps.name: Visit the doctor
steps.description: Go to the doctor's office with your health insurance card.

steps.name: Get a prescription
steps.description: Receive a prescription from the doctor.

steps.name: Visit the pharmacy
steps.description: Hand in your prescription at the pharmacy to get the medicine.

steps.name: Submit Exmatriculation Form
steps.description: Submit the completed form to the Student Office during office hours.
steps.deadline: End of semester or earlier if advised

steps.name: Close German bank account
steps.description: Close your German bank account if you have one.

steps.name: Return borrowed books
steps.description: Return any books you have borrowed to the university library.

steps.name: Deregister from German Health Insurance
steps.description: Deregister from the German Health Insurance with the deregistration certificate from HTW Dresden and the deregistration certificate from the Bürgerbüro (Resident Registration Office Dresden).
steps.deadline: De-registration is possible at the earliest one week before moving out or within two weeks after moving out.

steps.name: Deregister from Citizens' Office Dresden
steps.description: De-register from the Citizens' Office Dresden.
steps.deadline: De-registration is possible at the earliest one week before moving out or within two weeks after moving out.
